feed.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
feed.subtitle: ... because life's too short to stay home

entry.title: Destination: Stockholm
entry.content: Once the promised land, this Lake Pepin village now is a favorite day trip.

entry.title: America's freshwater Riviera
entry.content: On the gorgeous beaches of Wisconsin, Michigan, Indiana and Illinois, everyone can find a spot in the sun.

entry.title: Grand sand
entry.content: Along Lake Michigan, the Sleeping Bear Dunes are a giant playground for families.

entry.title: All eyes on Wabasha
entry.content: Eagles are drawn to this Mississippi River town, along with flocks of binocular-toting visitors.

entry.title: A slice of cheese country
entry.content: On Wisconsin's Badger State Trail, bicyclists bite off as much as they can chew.

entry.title: Cycling in coulee country
entry.content: The famous Elroy-Sparta is just one of the trails in a picturesque pocket of Wisconsin.

entry.title: Hiking in Duluth
entry.content: The city sections of the Superior Hiking Trail are easy to reach and amazingly scenic.

entry.title: Summer in the Brainerd Lakes
entry.content: Away from the crowds, Minnesota's busiest vacation area can be tranquil.

entry.title: Dreaming of Ely
entry.content: The wilderness around this north-woods town exerts a magnetic pull on city folk.

entry.title: Discovering Two Harbors
entry.content: This Lake Superior port town on Minnesota's North Shore is all about trains, boats and automobiles.

entry.title: Winter in Ely
entry.content: At the edge of the northern Minnesota wilderness, fun starts when the snow falls.

entry.title: Where to eat in Duluth
entry.content: Once famous for dives, this Lake Superior tourist magnet now boasts brewpubs and locavore cafes.
